decks.notes: The deck focuses on quickly developing a board presence with aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, supported by cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Guide of Souls to enhance their abilities. It also includes disruptive elements like Static Prison and Goblin Bombardment to control the opponent's board. The mana base is designed to provide consistent access to the necessary colors for casting spells efficiently. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast, aggressive strategy while also maintaining some control over the game.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana to play powerful creatures and combo pieces like Primeval Titan and Amulet of Vigor. By utilizing lands like Urza's Saga and Lotus Field, the deck can generate a large amount of mana to cast game-ending spells like Scapeshift or Malevolent Rumble. The key strategy is to efficiently search for the necessary pieces with cards like Expedition Map and Green Sun's Zenith, while also being able to protect important spells with cards like Boseiju, Who Endures. Overall, the deck aims to create explosive turns and overwhelm the opponent with its powerful combos.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quick aggression and removal, using cards like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah to deal damage, while Ocelot Pride and Guide of Souls provide support. Seasoned Pyromancer and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer help with card advantage and board presence. Cards like Galvanic Discharge and Thraben Charm offer additional removal options. Static Prison and Goblin Bombardment provide control elements. The mana base is optimized for consistency with a mix of lands including plains and fetchlands. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with fast, efficient threats while disrupting their game plan.

This deck focuses on disrupting opponent's resources while applying pressure with aggressive creatures. It utilizes cards like Path to Exile and Fatal Push to remove threats, while also generating value with Ephemerate and flicker effects. The deck aims to control the board with a combination of removal spells and creatures like Skyclave Apparition and Solitude, while also presenting a clock with evasive creatures like Flickerwisp and Emperor of Bones. The mana base is built to provide consistent access to colors needed for spells and ensure smooth gameplay.

The main focus of this Boros Aggro deck is to put constant pressure on the opponent by quickly deploying aggressive creatures and using burn spells to control the board. Cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury help in dealing damage early on, while cards like Goblin Bombardment and Galvanic Discharge provide removal options. The deck also includes cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Thraben Charm to provide additional value and support. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy.

The key concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to establish an aggressive board presence by playing efficient creatures and utilizing burn spells to control the board and close out the game quickly. This deck focuses on utilizing Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Ocelot Pride to pump up creatures and go for a fast win. Ranger-Captain of Eos helps to find key creatures when needed, while Static Prison and Goblin Bombardment provide additional control options. The deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain it throughout the game to overpower the opponent.

The key concept of this deck is to disrupt your opponent's game plan while building a board presence to quickly overwhelm them. By using cards like Thoughtseize, Fatal Push, and Relic of Progenitus, you can control the game and disrupt your opponent's resources. Additionally, utilizing creatures with enters-the-battlefield triggers like Flickerwisp and Ephemerate allows you to maximize value and maintain board presence. The aggressive nature of the deck paired with a taxing strategy can put your opponent on the back foot, allowing you to secure a swift victory.

This mono black aggro deck focuses on disruption and efficient threats to overwhelm the opponent. By using hand disruption like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek, along with removal spells like Fatal Push and Kozilek's Command, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while deploying threats like Nethergoyf and Emperor of Bones to quickly close out the game. The inclusion of cards like Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth and Urza's Saga provide additional utility and flexibility, making the deck a strong, aggressive option in the Modern format.

This deck focuses on using underword breach and grinding station to mill the opponent's library and then eventually win with Thassa's Oracle. It also includes various combo pieces like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Mishra's Bauble to generate value and dig through the deck quickly. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student helps to control the board while Malevolent Rumble and other spells provide disruption. The deck aims to combo off quickly and efficiently, using powerful cards like Urza's Saga and Mox Opal for mana acceleration.

The deck is focused on utilizing Underworld Breach to loop multiple spells from the graveyard, while also taking advantage of artifacts and Planeswalkers like Tamiyo and Emry to generate value and set up powerful combo plays. With cards like Grinding Station and Mishra's Bauble, the deck aims to mill itself to enable Breach combos or make use of cards like Thassa's Oracle for a win condition. Overall, the deck seeks to assemble its combo pieces efficiently and disrupt opponents with a mix of control elements and aggressive threats.

The focus of this deck is to utilize the combination of Archon of Cruelty and Indomitable Creativity to disrupt the opponent's strategy while setting up a powerful board presence. By utilizing cards like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Persist to generate value, along with disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push, the deck aims to create unique and unexpected interactions to gain an advantage. Additionally, the inclusion of Leyline of the Void and Witherbloom Command offers additional disruption and graveyard hate to further enhance the deck's strategy.

This deck focuses on utilizing efficient creatures and disruptive spells to disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining a strong aggressive presence on the board. By combining creatures with effects that exile or remove threats, along with spells that can protect important creatures, this deck aims to control the game's tempo and outvalue the opponent. By leveraging its aggressive creatures and disruptive spells, this deck aims to pressure the opponent while hindering their ability to execute their game plan effectively.

This deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly to summon powerful Eldrazi creatures and control the game by disrupting opponents with spells like Kozilek's Command and Kozilek's Return. The deck also utilizes cards like World Breaker and Emrakul, the Promised End to threaten the opponent with massive creatures. The deck is designed to overwhelm opponents with its Eldrazi monsters and disrupt their strategy, ultimately leading to victory through superior board presence and control.

The deck aims to slow down the opponent's strategy with control elements while ramping into powerful Eldrazi cards. It utilizes cards like Sowing Mycospawn and Kozilek's Command to control the board, while also using ramp cards like Utopia Sprawl and Eldrazi Temple to quickly bring out big threats like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker. Karn, the Great Creator is included to provide additional utility and disruption, and the deck is designed to overwhelm the opponent with large, hard-hitting creatures while maintaining control over the game.

The main concept of this deck is to combo off quickly using cards like Ral, Monsoon Mage, Ruby Medallion, and rituals to generate mana and cast spells for free or reduced cost. The deck aims to storm off with spells like Past in Flames to recast all spells from the graveyard and finish off the opponent with a massive Glimpse the Impossible or other big spell. The deck also includes card draw and filtering to help find combo pieces quickly and efficiently.

The key concept of this deck is to use a combination of creatures with enter-the-battlefield effects and sacrifice abilities to create a toolbox of options for different situations. By utilizing cards like Yawgmoth, Thran Physician and Agatha's Soul Cauldron, the deck can generate card advantage and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes a variety of creature tutors like Chord of Calling and Green Sun's Zenith to find specific creatures when needed. Overall, the deck aims to control the board and outvalue the opponent through synergistic creature interactions.
